title.value: DP-RDM: Adapting Diffusion Models to Private Domains Without Fine-Tuning
title.justification: Title is clear and matches the topic discussed in the text.
title.quote: DP-RDM: Adapting Diffusion Models to Private Domains Without Fine-Tuning

extractions.description: This paper develops a differentially private retrieval-augmented generation algorithm, DP-RDM, capable of generating high-quality image samples while providing provable privacy guarantees. It assumes access to a text-to-image diffusion model trained on a small amount of public data and designs a DP retrieval mechanism to augment the text prompt with samples retrieved from a private dataset, requiring no fine-tuning on the private data.

type.justification: The paper details an experiment involving the adaptation of diffusion models to private domains, evaluates the performance, and provides empirical results.
type.quote: We evaluate our DP-RDM on three datasets—CIFAR-10, MS-COCO and Shutterstock, a privately licensed dataset of 239M image-captions pairs—and show that it can effectively adapt to these datasets privately with minor loss in generation quality.

name.justification: The paper revolves around developing a new algorithm using deep learning models for image generation.
name.quote: Text-to-image diffusion models (Ho et al., 2020; Song et al., 2020) enable highly customizable image generation, producing photo-realistic image samples that can be instructed through text prompting.

name.justification: The paper discusses the development and use of generative models, specifically diffusion models for generating images.
name.quote: We develop the first differentially private (DP) retrieval-augmented generation algorithm that is capable of generating high-quality image samples while providing provable privacy guarantees.

name.justification: The name DP-RDM is clearly stated multiple times in the paper.
name.quote: We develop the first differentially private (DP) retrieval-augmented generation algorithm that is capable of generating high-quality image samples while providing provable privacy guarantees.

name.justification: ImageNet FB is mentioned as a dataset used in the experiments.
name.quote: trained on face-blurred ImageNet, using different private retrieval datasets at inference time: Shutterstock, MS-COCO with face-blurring (FB), ImageNet FB, and CIFAR-10.
